intro: Dendrosenecio johnstonii, commonly known as the giant groundsels, is a striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Kenya and Tanzania. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in high-altitude environments. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Dendrosenecio johnstonii is also notable for its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for various pollinators.
